seo.title: Positano-instagramsteder (uten folkemengdene)
seo.description: Fotogene steder med beste tidspunkt for å unngå kø, samt undervurderte alternativer.

intro: Finn fotogene steder i Positano uten folkemengdene – med riktig timing og alternative vinkler.

sections.title: Classic postcard shots
body: Shoot from the Church of Santa Maria Assunta steps just after sunrise; the beach is empty and the dome glows warm.
Walk to the ferry pier for a wide-angle view back towards the cliffside—arrive before 09:00 when day-trip queues form.

sections.title: Underrated angles
body: Climb to the viewpoint on Via Trara Genoino above Fornillo for a layered shot of fishing boats and pastel houses.
Ride the local bus to Nocelle, then capture the coast from the Path of the Gods terrace; the panorama is unbeatable on clear mornings.

sections.title: Golden hour setups
body: Grab a spot on the Via Cristoforo Colombo benches about 45 minutes before sunset; the sun drops behind the Li Galli islands in summer.
Head to Laurito beach for silhouettes of Positano’s skyline—stairs are steep, so wear grippy shoes and carry a headlamp for the walk back.

sections.title: Photo etiquette
body: Keep tripods compact and step aside once you’ve taken a frame so staircases stay passable.
Avoid drones inside town limits; Italian regulations require permits and fines are hefty when guards spot unlicensed flights.

tips: Vis hensyn til lokalbefolkning og butikker; ikke blokker innganger i smale gater.
Ta med ekstra batteri og plass på minnekortet – du er ofte borte fra lademuligheter.

a: For nattebilder eller blåtime er et lett stativ nyttig; ellers holder håndholdt med god stabilisering.
Droner krever tillatelse og er forbudt over tett bebyggelse; bruk dem kun med gyldig lisens og klarering.

fallback.intro: Positano is photogenic from almost every angle — but the most popular spots are busy for much of the day. Here’s how to capture the classic views without long queues, plus underrated alternatives.

items.title: Spiaggia Grande
items.description: Arrive at sunrise for empty docks and calm water; avoid mid‑morning queues.

items.title: Fornillo path
items.description: Gentle coastal walkway with layered cliff views; best early or just after sunset.

items.title: Via Pasitea bends
items.description: Elevated curves give the postcard angle without crowds. Respect traffic and stay off the road.

items.title: Chiesa Nuova terraces
items.description: Golden hour over Fornillo; minimal crowds and a short walk from the hostel.
Sweeping ridge lines; light is best early.

sunset.heading: Sunset choices
paragraphs: For crowd‑free golden hour, head to upper Via Pasitea pull‑offs or the terraces near Chiesa Nuova.
If you prefer beach silhouettes, arrive 30–45 minutes before sunset at Fornillo.

etiquette.heading: Etiquette & local tips
items: Don’t block narrow stairs or roads; take the shot and step aside.
Respect private property and avoid climbing walls/roofs.
Use a small tripod off‑peak; avoid busy paths in midday.

items.summary: What’s the best time for photos?
items.body: Sunrise for emptier scenes; golden hour for warm tones and softer shadows.

drone.summary: Do I need a drone permit?
drone.body: Italy has strict drone rules and many no-fly zones. Always check ENAC guidance and local regulations; avoid flying near crowds.
